shared_utils package

Submodules

shared_utils.api_versioning module

API Versioning System Provides API versioning support to ensure backward compatibility.

class shared_utils.api_versioning.APIVersion(default_version: str = 'v1', supported_versions: list | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

API Version Manager

Functionality:

Manages API versions and routes requests to appropriate version handlers. Supports semantic versioning (major.minor.patch) and backward compatibility.

Parameters:

  • default_version (str) – Default API version (e.g., “v1”)

  • supported_versions (list) – List of supported API versions

get_latest_version() → str[source]

Get the latest supported API version.

Returns:

Latest version string

Return type:

str

get_version_from_request() → str[source]

Extract API version from request (header or URL path).

Functionality:

Checks for version in: 1. URL path (/api/v1/…) 2. Accept header (application/vnd.api.v1+json) 3. X-API-Version header

Returns:

API version or default version

Return type:

str

is_version_supported(version: str) → bool[source]

Check if a version is supported.

Parameters:

version (str) – API version to check

Returns:

True if version is supported

Return type:

bool

register_version(version: str, blueprint: Blueprint)[source]

Register a blueprint for a specific API version.

Parameters:

  • version (str) – API version (e.g., “v1”, “v2”)

  • blueprint (Blueprint) – Flask blueprint for this version

Returns:

None

shared_utils.api_versioning.create_versioned_blueprint(version: str, name: str, import_name: str, url_prefix: str | None = None) → Blueprint[source]

Create a versioned blueprint.

Functionality:

Creates a Flask blueprint with version prefix. Automatically registers with API version manager.

Parameters:

  • version (str) – API version (e.g., “v1”)

  • name (str) – Blueprint name

  • import_name (str) – Import name

  • url_prefix (str, optional) – URL prefix (default: /api/{version})

Returns:

Versioned Flask blueprint

Return type:

Blueprint

shared_utils.api_versioning.get_api_version_manager() → APIVersion[source]

Get or create the global API version manager.

Returns:

Global API version manager instance

Return type:

APIVersion

shared_utils.api_versioning.init_api_versioning(default_version: str = 'v1', supported_versions: list | None = None) → APIVersion[source]

Initialize the global API version manager.

Parameters:

  • default_version (str) – Default API version

  • supported_versions (list) – List of supported versions

Returns:

Initialized API version manager

Return type:

shared_utils.api_versioning.versioned_route(version: str, rule: str, **options)[source]

Decorator to create versioned routes.

Functionality:

Creates a route that is version-specific. Routes are automatically prefixed with /api/{version}/

Parameters:

  • version (str) – API version (e.g., “v1”)

  • rule (str) – URL rule

  • **options – Additional route options

Returns:

Decorator function

Return type:

function

shared_utils.cache_manager module

Cache Manager Provides caching functionality for frequently accessed data like room availability and user data. Supports both in-memory caching and Redis (if available).

class shared_utils.cache_manager.CacheManager(redis_host: str | None = None, redis_port: int | None = None, redis_db: int = 0, default_ttl: int = 300)[source]

Bases: object

Cache Manager for storing and retrieving cached data.

Functionality:

Provides caching mechanism for frequently accessed data. Supports both Redis (distributed) and in-memory caching. Automatically handles cache expiration and key generation.

Parameters:

  • redis_host (str, optional) – Redis host (default: from env or ‘localhost’)

  • redis_port (int, optional) – Redis port (default: from env or 6379)

  • redis_db (int, optional) – Redis database number (default: 0)

  • default_ttl (int, optional) – Default time-to-live in seconds (default: 300)

cached(prefix: str, ttl: int | None = None)[source]

Decorator to cache function results.

Parameters:

  • prefix (str) – Cache key prefix

  • ttl (int, optional) – Time-to-live in seconds

Returns:

Decorated function with caching

Return type:

function

clear(pattern: str | None = None) → int[source]

Clear cache entries.

Parameters:

pattern (str, optional) – Pattern to match keys (e.g., “room:*”)

Returns:

Number of keys deleted

Return type:

int

delete(key: str) → bool[source]

Delete a key from cache.

Parameters:

key (str) – Cache key to delete

Returns:

True if successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

get(key: str) → Any | None[source]

Retrieve a value from cache.

Parameters:

key (str) – Cache key

Returns:

Cached value if found and not expired, None otherwise

Return type:

Any or None

set(key: str, value: Any, ttl: int | None = None) → bool[source]

Store a value in cache.

Parameters:

  • key (str) – Cache key

  • value (Any) – Value to cache (must be JSON serializable)

  • ttl (int, optional) – Time-to-live in seconds (default: self.default_ttl)

Returns:

True if successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

shared_utils.cache_manager.init_cache_manager(redis_host: str | None = None, redis_port: int | None = None, redis_db: int = 0, default_ttl: int = 300) → CacheManager[source]

shared_utils.circuit_breaker module

Simple Circuit Breaker Pattern Implementation Provides fault tolerance for inter-service communication.

class shared_utils.circuit_breaker.CircuitBreaker(failure_threshold: int = 5, recovery_timeout: int = 60, expected_exception: type = <class 'Exception'>)[source]

Bases: object

Simple circuit breaker implementation.

States: - CLOSED: Normal operation, requests pass through - OPEN: Too many failures, reject requests immediately - HALF_OPEN: Testing if service recovered, allow limited requests

call(func: Callable, *args, **kwargs) → Any[source]

Execute function with circuit breaker protection.

Parameters:

  • func – Function to execute

  • *args – Arguments for function

  • **kwargs –

    Arguments for function

Returns:

Function result

Raises:

  • CircuitBreakerOpenError – If circuit is open

  • Exception – Original exception from function

reset()[source]

Manually reset circuit breaker to closed state.

exception shared_utils.circuit_breaker.CircuitBreakerOpenError[source]

Bases: Exception

Raised when circuit breaker is open and request is rejected.

class shared_utils.circuit_breaker.CircuitState(*values)[source]

Bases: Enum

CLOSED = 'closed'
HALF_OPEN = 'half_open'
OPEN = 'open'
shared_utils.circuit_breaker.call_service_with_circuit_breaker(service_name: str, method: str, url: str, **kwargs) → Response[source]

Make HTTP request to another service with circuit breaker protection.

Parameters:

  • service_name – Name of target service (‘users’, ‘rooms’, etc.)

  • method – HTTP method (‘GET’, ‘POST’, etc.)

  • url – Full URL to call

  • **kwargs – Additional arguments for requests (headers, json, timeout, etc.)

Returns:

Response object

Raises:

  • CircuitBreakerOpenError – If circuit is open

  • requests.RequestException – If request fails

shared_utils.circuit_breaker.get_circuit_breaker_status(service_name: str = None) → dict[source]

Get status of circuit breaker(s).

Parameters:

service_name – Name of service, or None for all services

Returns:

Dictionary with circuit breaker status

shared_utils.circuit_breaker.reset_circuit_breaker(service_name: str) → dict[source]

Manually reset a circuit breaker.

Parameters:

service_name – Name of service to reset

Returns:

Success message

shared_utils.error_handler module

Custom Exception Handling Framework Provides standardized error handling and error messages across all services.

exception shared_utils.error_handler.APIException(message: str, status_code: int = 500, error_code: str | None = None, details: Dict | None = None)[source]

Bases: Exception

Base exception class for API errors.

Functionality:

Base class for all custom API exceptions. Provides standardized error response format.

Parameters:

  • message (str) – Error message

  • status_code (int) – HTTP status code (default: 500)

  • error_code (str, optional) – Application-specific error code

  • details (dict, optional) – Additional error details

to_dict() → Dict[str, Any][source]

Convert exception to dictionary for JSON response.

Returns:

Error response dictionary

Return type:

dict

exception shared_utils.error_handler.AuthenticationError(message: str = 'Authentication required', details: Dict | None = None)[source]

Bases: APIException

Exception for authentication errors (401 Unauthorized).

Functionality:

Raised when authentication fails.

exception shared_utils.error_handler.AuthorizationError(message: str = 'Insufficient permissions', required_role: str | None = None, details: Dict | None = None)[source]

Bases: APIException

Exception for authorization errors (403 Forbidden).

Functionality:

Raised when user lacks required permissions.

Bases: APIException

Exception for resource conflict errors (409 Conflict).

Functionality:

Raised when operation conflicts with existing resource state.

Bases: APIException

Exception for service unavailable errors (503 Service Unavailable).

Functionality:

Functionality:

Create a standardized error response.

Functionality:

Helper function to create standardized error responses.

  • status_code (int) – HTTP status code

  • error_code (str, optional) – Error code

  • details (dict, optional) – Additional details

Returns:

(JSON response, status_code)

Register global error handlers for Flask application.

Functionality:

Registers error handlers for custom exceptions and general exceptions. Provides standardized error responses across all services.
